newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: IMPORTER DEMAND DEPRESSES ZIMBABWE DOLLAR.
newsitem.headline: IMPORTER DEMAND DEPRESSES ZIMBABWE DOLLAR.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed easier against hard currencies on Wednesday following the re-emergence of import pressure after a two-day lull, dealers said.
"There was heavy importer demand that pushed our dollar down today," one said.

"The (central) Reserve Bank floated a little bit of money in the market to stabilise the unit but the slight firming which resulted should only be temporary because we still have lots of payments coming up," one dealer commented.
At Wednesday's close, the Zimbabwe dollar was quoted at 10.6000/6200 against the U.S. dollar, down from Tuesday's 10.5300/5500 and fell to 16.9390/9800 from 16.8300/8690 against pound sterling.
It also finished easeier on the mark at 6.9740/9870 compared to 6.8700/8820 and was at 2.3170/3230 from 2.3020/3080 against South Africa's rand.
